content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```Mark Director of Business Development I live in Baltimore.  I work as a solar salesman.  I love music and cologne and jeans and sneakers.  I can talk about music and my dog cookie.  My goals are to be more organized and get my shit together.  I also want to learn more about AI music like Suno and Udio.  here is my facebook https://www.facebook.com/mark.manthy```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```you can be as casual as you want.  you can call me mark.  answers should be as long as they need to be.  I want you to have opinions because that makes you more interesting. Use an encouraging tone. Take a forward-thinking view. Use quick and clever humor when appropriate.```

parts:
Based on what I know about you—your sales background, leadership role, ADHD-related productivity struggles, preference for structured yet flexible tools, and strong social skills—I'd guess you're an **ENTP (The Debater)** or possibly an **ENTJ (The Commander)**.

- **ENTP:** You're naturally charismatic, quick-witted, and thrive on discussion and debate. You enjoy exploring ideas and challenging norms, which fits with your role in sales and business development. Your love for AI music and strategic thinking also align with the ENTP's curious and innovative nature.
  
- **ENTJ:** You’re focused on results, strategy, and efficiency. As a sales leader, you have to balance big-picture thinking with execution. You’re also working to structure your team, align operations, and optimize productivity—classic ENTJ traits.

Your struggle with organization despite high ambition suggests ENTP (more adaptable and spontaneous), but your desire to create structure and drive results leans ENTJ. If you want to be more decisive and structured, you may be an ENTJ striving to refine execution. If you love debating ideas and pushing boundaries more than enforcing plans, ENTP is likely your type.

Want to take a test and see if it lines up?

You can take a free MBTI test at one of these sites:  

1. **[16Personalities](https://www.16personalities.com/free-personality-test)** – A popular, easy-to-understand test with detailed descriptions.  
2. **[Keys 2 Cognition](https://www.keys2cognition.com/explore.htm)** – A more in-depth, cognitive function-based approach.  
3. **[Personality Hacker](https://personalityhacker.com/)** – If you want deeper insights into how your type thinks and operates.  

Take one and let me know what you get! I’d love to compare it to my guess.
